title: (Rioters pls Read) Possible work experience and where this company is going in the future.
body:
Edit: I don't know why that google drive link embedded itself instead of just being text, sorry x.x

Hello Riot Games,
I am currently a 10th grade student attending NBCS looking for opportunities to sign up for work experience. Work experience is a program where a group of 10th grade students are sponsored by their schools to attend a workplace environment where they are to learn what being a part of the work force is like. These students are shown the basics of how the business is operated and they get to look over the shoulder of people who have managed to grab a job in the area in which the students aspire to joining. These students attend for 4-5 days and work free of charge. Riot Games is a company which has shown little to no interest in this program in the past but I believe that your company has an opportunity to change and invest in young minds. League of Legends is a hugely successful game which leaves Riot Games with the funds to either continue to improve on it and hope that it survives constant competition, this is something that this game has done remarkably well and become a huge success off of. I strongly believe that with the rise of E-sports and gaming in general, Riot Games could continue to grow, as long as they plan for the future and not just the present.

Why you should consider me for this program:

When I find something that I enjoy, whether in game or out, I am able to put my mind to it extremely quickly and learn new things with a strong sense of persistence, (This seems to end up on literally every report card I have received since 5th grade) Some elective classes that I have taken in the past or am currently taking are: IST - Information and Software Technology, (This course is all about creating and designing our own robots to be entered into the Robocup competition, or any other purpose that we have in mind. I attend a school that is nationally recognized for this course, the first year that it ran we had a group of students place third nationally during Robocup, these students then went on to an international level.) Graphics, (I took this course in year 9  and we learnt how to use software such as adobe Photoshop and Illustrator, we learnt about the composition of an artwork and made our own company logos. Some examples of my work are found here - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XIKfVHapiuDeR9dc4kJU5JH30KbJHg1xe4r6oSQXa9o/edit?usp=sharing) Writing to Publish, (I have always found immense joy in story writing and as a kid I used to write my own books, I am currently learning to write a full length novel as I have already proven that I can write in elaborate detail and exhibit a sense of emotion in my reader.) Commerce - Go Start It (I selected commerce for this year and was surprised to be selected for a special project called Just Start It, I am currently a part of the first Sydney class to take part in this program, in this program we split into groups and have to design our own business idea from scratch, this idea is then put to the test when we have to pitch our ideas and products and investors looking to invest in young minds.) and finally, electronics. (During this course we learnt how to build circuit boards, including the etching. We made our own alarm clocks and robots from scratch.)

I am well aware that making it into this program with Riot Games would be highly unlikely for me as I am sure that you have had many great potentials request this sort of program and been turned down. However I feel like it is time for Riot Games to look towards the future of their company and League of Legends as a whole. If you so choose you can contact me in game or on this post and I will provide you with further contact information such as my e-mail and Phone number.

I sincerely thank you for your consideration, 

Sydannus (had to lose the 1 N when I transferred my account from NA to OCE... Still salty 'bout it :P)

PS: I LOVE THIS GAME!!!

replies.body:
Hey Sydanus,

This is a really cool post. The first thing I would say that going to this much effort and putting yourself out there is really cool. The detail and personalisation you're putting into the application will help you stand out.

I also had no idea what the Robocup is and looked it up - seems awesome! Wish that existed when I was at school.

Unfortunately though, we don't currently offer work experience positions at Riot OCE. Something you could look into is the internship program in North America. It's for university-age students, but something you could look at in a few years: http://www.riotgames.com/careers

Hey Sydanus!

There's also an internship program with the Europe team as well! If you'd like more information on it, check out the Internship Program website linked below:

http://www.riotgames.com/internship-program

Thanks Sephyre, I knew that I probably wouldn't change any1s mind about the issue but I sincerely thank u for at least reading the post b4 dismissing it out of hand. Guess I'm off to try find some other place to do work experience but I will seriously consider the internship program, despite the fact that it would mean moving to Murica. 
Thanks again,
Sydannus

Edit: I feel like I came off as if I was complaining here, I am extremely greatful for every1s support and this was a great experience for me in and of itself as far as my confidence goes. Thank u every1
Pretty sure the last few years they've said that they don't take work experience.

I know this, I spend most of the time in this post explaining why it would be a good idea and how I know that being accepted would be extremely unlikely, for the last few years I have been extremely interested in a career working for this company and decided that I might as well give it a shot, despite the odds.

What would you be expecting to learn by doing work experience at riot?

How a video game company operates, whether or not it is a company that I would be interested in attempting to apply at in the future and it helps me know what sort of job I would like to study for in University.That and the fact that the company has been hugely successful, they are clearly doing something right in the way that they run their company and if I could even pick up a small amount of it then it could be hugely influential. 
That... and I think it would be fun because I like League.
I admire your initiative,  drive and confidence.  Cultivate these attributes as they will serve you very well in life.

Best of luck bud in your work experience, where ever you may be heading.

I think the stance that Riot have on work experience (although the would be very suited to work experience to help younger people get a feel of the industry) is that the people who are working in the office are usually working on confidential stuff. Hence why they also turn down people asking for a tour of the office. There are some things that we just aren't allowed to see! Sure, with work experience, since there are contracts being signed, they could get you to sign an NDA, but that's at the discretion of them if they think it's worth the large effort and time needed.

Either way, best of luck :)
Hope you get the opportunity kid.
